body.name: Doona Lab - SensAlert Child Car Seat Alert Solution - App Included
body.stockDetail: Only 2 left in stock - order soon.
features: Ensuring Peace of Mind - SensAlert is the only child car seat alert solution that combines technology and safety to offer parents peace of mind in any vehicle. With three incremental levels of alert, the cloud-based system sends push notifications and calls, so it does not depend on the phone’s signal or status.

Safety at Your Fingertips - SensAlert is connected through Bluetooth technology to the caregiver’s smartphone. Doona app is running on the caregiver’s smartphone (app available for Android and iOS systems) and operates seamlessly with other devices without interference.

Sharing SensAlert - SensAlert can be shared with up to 3 people simultaneously. Each user can choose up to 5 emergency contacts in the app. The system provides the emergency contacts with the GPS location.
Easy Installation - The pad fits easily on the bottom of the carseat with a hole for the buckle to come through. It is designed to fit most car seats for children (all groups) and boosters seats.
Durable & Comfortable - SensAlert has a foam padding making it comfortable for your little one to sit on, and has a removable cover that is machine washable, making it a breeze to keep clean.

Doona Car Seat child and baby alert system with mobile app Doona is a visionary company committed to simplifying baby travel for parents. Our baby car seat sensor makes life on the go easy, without ever compromising on functionality, safety, and quality. Our mission is to develop innovative infant and child travel solutions that make day to day parenting easier. The goal is to truly make an impact on parents' lives by providing a baby alert system, as well as travel strollers and accessories that simplify parenthood and make life on the go easy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So worth the peace of mind
reviews.reviewText: My son and daughter-in-law both work and their 18-month-old goes to daycare part-time and is not always dropped off by the same parent. It would be so easy to be distracted and forget and leave the child in a hot car. These fit right in the car seat and will alarm to your phone if you forget, it's so worth the $99 for peace of mind

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is very sensitive to the point of inaccuracy. Also it’s what your child has to sit on and it’s not cushioned. Like sitting on a board

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Peace of mind for parents
reviews.reviewText: Even most careful parents may forget their babies in the car even for a couple of minutes. This easy to use tech safety device can prevent tragic events. It is a well worth of money for peace of mind for parents. Dona SensAlert is an extra security addition to child car seats. It automatically sends alerts to the main registered number and emergency contacts when a child is left unattended in the car. It works both with Bluetooth and cloud, so you will always receive notifications even with minimum reception. The app runs in the background and sends push notifications. Be aware that you need to agree and provide multiple permissions to the app to do its job, like access to contacts, allow push notifications allow track motion and fitness activities. In case you forget the child, the main registered number first get alerted and if not responded it sends alerts to emergency contacts. The battery lasts about 12 months and no need to constant charging.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Frequently miscalculates phone proximity to car seat sensor. Defective or not, it’s become a headache and distraction rather than safe guard.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Wanted to love them
reviews.reviewText: These literally connect and disconnect constantly even with the phone right there or while we are driving. It’s kind of annoying.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Great idea, needs some tweaks
reviews.reviewText: This is a great idea and awesome peace of mind if you have a little one. It’s so easy to get distracted, especially if you are out of a normal routine, and forget that it’s your day for daycare drop off. This seems like a great way to build in reminders and safeguards just in case. Hope I never run into a problem, but it’s nice to have a backup just in case.That said, this seems a little touchy to the point of annoyance. The connection is unreliable which makes it a little frustrating. The physical sensor and the app are both easy to install and use, and I think they can probably work through some of the bumps, so I think it has a lot of potential. Just not quite there yet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Peace of mind, but Bluetooth connection could be a bit better
reviews.reviewText: I like the concept for this product and, for the most part, this product really delivers. While you may think you could never leave your kid in the car (and I certainly haven’t yet), I have heard plenty of stories from parents doing just this over the years when severely sleep deprived or newly learning to juggle many things at once (groceries, stroller, other kids, etc). And even if this truly would never happen to you, this could give you extra peace of mind when letting your LO go off with grandparents or baby sitter, or another caregiver. I like that the device itself is soft and not too big, and seems to be a fairly universal fit for most car seats, and that the cover is machine washable of course. I also like that the app has escalating alerts, so you have two chances/ reminders before it sends out an alert to contact your other emergency contacts. It’s also nice that one device can link to 3 different peoples apps, and each of them can add multiple emergency contacts, so hopefully there would always be someone to receive the alert in the extreme situation where it was really needed. The only thing I think could be improved is the app itself, or the connection maybe; I’ve had the device unpair with my phone’s Bluetooth, which is annoying. Hopefully that’s just a minor glitch that can be ironed out. I have been able to reconnect it, but it’s annoying and if you didn’t notice, then it negates the point of the whole thing. Anyways, interesting new baby tech; glad I got a chance to give it a try. Price point seems reasonable for all that it has to offer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the peace of mind. The app could be improved.
reviews.reviewText: $99 seems steep, but it’s worth the peace of mind. You hope or think you could never forget a child in the car, but I’d rather be safe. This alerts you if it detects the baby is still inside the car seat and it has Bluetooth connectivity. The only issue I see with it is that the app freezes and crashes sometimes. Honestly, these type of security systems should be standard on all car seats. I highly recommend it!
